Package nachos.machine

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ExceptionHandler
    This is the interface implemented by an object registered by the OS as a handler for machine exceptions that occur while executing in user mode.
    InterruptHandler
    This is the interface implemented by the object registered by a device driver as a handler for interrupts caused by the managed device.
    Releasable
    Interface implemented by objects that (like locks) can be released.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Console
    This class defines a hardware console device.
    CPU
    An object of this class represents an individual CPU.
    Disk
    This class defines a physical disk I/O device.
    Disk.Geometry
    Class whose objects bundle up the parameters that constitutes the "geometry" of a disk.
    Machine
    This class defines the simulated host workstation hardware, as seen by user programs -- the CPU registers, main memory, etc.
    MIPS
    MIPS emulator, for simulating the execution of user programs running on top of Nachos.
    NachosThread
    Nachos threads class.
    Network
    Network that provides ordered, reliable delivery of limited-size packets to other machines on the nachos network.
    Packet
    A link-layer packet.
    RK05Disk
    This version of the Disk class simulates a physical disk device with the geometry (203 cylinders, 2 heads, 12 sectors per track, 512 bytes per sector) of the old RK05 disk packs used on PDP-11 minicomputers in the mid-1970s.
    SegmentDescriptor
    This class defines an entry in a segment table.
    SerialPort
    This class simulates a simplified version of a UART (Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter) device.
    Simulation
    This class drives the simulation by maintaining the list of pending interrupts, a notion of system global time as well as a local time for each CPU, and determining the next interrupt to be handled by a specified CPU.
    Statistics
    This class defines the statistics that are to be kept about Nachos behavior -- how much time (ticks) elapsed, how many user instructions executed, etc.
    TestAndSetVariable<T>
    Objects of this class simulate shared memory locations with an atomic test-and-set operation that can be used for multiprocessor synchronization.
    Timer
    This class emulates a hardware timer device.
    TranslationEntry
    This class defines an entry in a translation table -- either in a page table or a TLB.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    MachineException
    Class that defines the various exceptions that can occur during the execution of user code.
    MalformedPacketException
    Thrown when a malformed packet is processed.
